summary: This is an email correspondence between legal professionals regarding the case United States v. Maxwell. It includes the forwarding of a Daubert opinion on an individual named Rocchio, issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan, which was to be docketed the following day.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Issued the Daubert opinion and order in the case US v. Maxwell. Her chambers sent the document.

persons.name: Nathan NYSD Chambers
persons.context: Sent the email attaching Judge Nathan's opinion and order to the recipients.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Recipient of the email containing the Daubert opinion.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Recipient of the email containing the Daubert opinion.

persons.name: Rocchio
persons.context: The Daubert opinion issued by Judge Nathan concerns this individual, likely an expert or witness in the case.

connections.description: The chambers staff acts on behalf of and under the authority of Judge Nathan.
Chambers staff sent a legal document to attorney Jeff Pagliuca.
Chambers staff sent a legal document to attorney Laura Menninger.
Judge Nathan issued a Daubert opinion concerning Rocchio, a procedural ruling on evidence.

events.title: Daubert Opinion Issued
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issued a Daubert opinion and order concerning an individual named Rocchio in the case US v. Maxwell.

events.title: Document Docketing
events.description: The opinion and order was scheduled to be formally docketed in the court record the morning after the email was sent.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A Daubert opinion concerning an individual named Rocchio was issued by Judge Alison J. Nathan in the case US v. Maxwell.
The opinion was circulated via email on November 11, 2021, and was scheduled for official docketing on November 12, 2021.
The correspondence involves Assistant U.S. Attorneys and defense attorneys (Pagliuca and Menninger), indicating it pertains to a significant procedural ruling in the criminal trial.
The document reference '20cr330' confirms this is related to the federal criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
